title: Product Circuit: Controllable Pipe Valve
skills: ESP32, Arduino IDE, Motor Controller, LCD Display
description: As an engineer at Notifai; a company making enterprise enviromental and air quality sensing solutions, I assembled a prototype of a valve opening system. This used design incorporated a new TI low power motor controller, with current sensing. I used an ESP32 and a simple GPIO controller app for it to demo opening and closing the valve over wifi. A simple looping program was also made test how many open and closes could be made on a battery, results were displayed on an LCD.

title: Product Circuit: STM8S RGB LED and Button Board(PCB)
skills: PCB(Altium), IAR IDE, Buttons, LED, UART
description: As an engineer at Notifai; a company making enterprise enviromental and air quality sensing solutions, I made an addition for our LoRa Gateway we needed a button and indicator lighting. The best option was to make a seperate PCB board for it that communicates to the gateway over UART. For this I did the full design in Altium PCB Design software, and had hundreds of them manufactured.

title: Product Circuit: Pi Pico Enviroment and Air Quality Device
skills: Parts(CO2, PM, TVOC, Temp., Humidity, E-Paper, Neopixels, LoRa Module), Comms(UART, i2c, SPI)
description: As an engineer at Notifai; a company making enterprise enviromental and air quality sensing solutions, I made a protoype of our upcoming Pi Pico based air quality and enviromaental device that included many modules (PM, CO2, TVOC, temperature, humidity, e-paper, neopixels,  and LoRa module) for comms (UART, SPI and i2c). All of these components required being able to hotplug into the main board, and then display and send data.

title: Demo Circuit: E-Paper with Raspberry Pi
skills: GooDisplay/Waveshare E-Paper, Batter Pack, Raspberry Pi, Python
description: As an engineer at Notifai; a company making enterprise enviromental and air quality sensing solutions, I made as a demo of our upcoming Pi Pico product I used a Raspberry Pi 3B+ to easily show data on an e-paper screen. To make it more realistic I used a GraphQL library to pull our live data of other devices from a out GraphQL Server. The a small battery pack was used to make the device wireless.

title: Product Circuit: Scent Diffuser
skills: Device(ESP8266 MCU), Program(C, HTML) Parts(Atomizer, LED)
description: While a student at Simon Fraser University I worked with a student startup to create a prototype for a app controller scent diffuser. I used and ESP8266 as the controller which could connect to the internet to control vairous components. The electonics included WS2812 RGB LEDs, and for the diffusion I originally designed a Colpitts Oscillator to drive the piezo, but later decided an off the self circuit was chosen and integfrated with our circuit.

title: Product Circuit: Security Keypad(PCB)
description: During my time working for a new company called Plasmatic Technologies Inc.; a company that is making an internet connected home security system, I designed versions of our PCB. To use as the keypad buttons I built capacitive touch buttons and a capacitive proximity sensor. This also inlcluded surface mount components such as the ICs, discrete components, and RGB LEDS, also through hole parts and cuts for back mounted LEDS, and probe points.

title: Product Circuit: Security Keypad(MCU)
skills: Devices(TI MCU), Parts(Capacitive Touch PCB, Security Systems)
description: During my time working for a new company called Plasmatic Technologies Inc.; a company that is making an internet connected home security system. In order to work with our keypad that uses capacitive touch we used a TI MCU specifically for baing able to detect it. Other electronic connections necessary were for data communication, such as UART to the MPU and data from existing security systems which included voltage conversion down to 3.3V.

title: Product Circuit: Security Keypad(MPU Components)
skills: Devices(Linux Debian MPU), Parts(LED(POV), LCD, Speaker)
description: During my time working for a new company called Plasmatic Technologies Inc.; a company that is making an internet connected home security system, I worked with various components that were controlled by our MPU such as RGB LEDs using a charlieplexing and POV circuits to minimize pins used. Speakers using I2S, and an LCD screen which used SPi for data and I2C for the capacitive touch screen.

title: Side Project: Automatic Scoreboard
description: As a side project I decided to build a table top hockey game, for this I wanted an automated scoreboard and clock. I used 2 1-digit for the goals and a 4-digit 7-segment display for the time. Since this required a pin for each of the 7 segments and a pin for each of the 6 digits a shift register was used to have enough. A button was used to reset the timer and small IR interupt sensors to detect a goal.

title: Side Project: Controllable and PID Pulley
skills: Device(TI MCU), Parts(Motor Control[PWM, PID], IR Buttons)
description: For an SFU Course using MCUs I chose to do a custom project, rather than a set project like the rest of the students. For this I made a pulley project in which I sourced the parts, such as a high torque motor, high current motor contoller, buttons, and IR sensors for end stops. It was programmed to be directional and speed controlled(PWM), and a PID to automatically find the middle.
